intro: Psychotria ihuensis, commonly known as the Ihuense Psychotria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. Psychotria ihuensis is also known for its psychoactive properties, containing alkaloids similar to those found in other members of the genus. Due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal value, it is of interest to botanists and researchers alike.
